priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Specimen Collection Method Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C132314

self.title: CDISC SDTM Specimen Collection Method Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the method used in specimen collection.
name: Specimen Collection Method
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Specimen Collection Method Terminology

terms.definition: A technique in which suction is used to remove bodily fluid or tissue.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
The removal of tissue with a curette (a spoon-shaped instrument with a sharp edge).
A technique in which material is cleared from the throat or lungs by coughing it up and spitting it out.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body with a thin needle.
A technique in which the tip of a finger is pricked with a lancing device to obtain a small quantity of capillary blood.
A technique in which hypotonic saline is inhaled, followed by expectoration.
A technique in which a fluid is introduced and collected from a body cavity or location.
A surgical procedure in which tissue is removed from the body.
A technique in which a tufted material on the end of a stick is rubbed against a surface.
